Description.val:
The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $0.003 million to reflect the Department of Navy's effort to support the Office of Management and Budget directed reforms for Efficiency and Effectiveness that include a lean, accountable, more efficient government.

Jet Assisted Take Offs (JATOs) and Rocket Assisted Take Offs (RATOs) are solid propellant rocket motors used in matched pairs to launch BQM-74 and BQM-177 targets respectively in support of Combat System Ship Qualification Trials (CSSQT) for Navy surface ships and other fleet events.

In FY 2019, the program will continue procurement of the Mk-85 RATO to support the BQM-177 Subsonic Aerial Target (SSAT) operations. The program has begun a transition from the Mk-117 JATO to the Mk-85 RATO to support the change in requirement.

Justification.val:
The FY 2019 baseline funding is required to support the procurement for the Mk-85 Rocket Assisted Take Offs (RATOs). The RATOs are required in accordance with the fleet needs/fielding of the BQM-177 and to maintain inventory levels for fleet training and qualification usage with the new Subsonic Aerial Target. Procurements through the FYDP are for operationally configured units to satisfy the requirement of applicable specifications of RATO. The Mk-85 RATO also requires the procurement of an appropriate container that is shipboard certified.  

Additional Baseline funding is required for  production engineering support, integrated logistics support, and reliability life (i.e. safety and product improvement program, as well as quality assurance and acceptance testing). During the Mk-117/Mk-85 transition, production support costs will increase to support both variants.

OCO: 
FY 2019 Overseas Contingency Operations (OCO) is required to procure MK 117 JATOs used in pre-deployment combat qualification exercises in support of Operation Inherent Resolve (OIR).

Name.val: Jet Assisted Take Off (JATOs)/Rocket Assisted Take Off (RATOs)

Name.@footnote: Mk 85 RATO: FY18 and FY19 Mk-85 quantity increased to support fleet operational training and joint exercise requirements. FY18 and FY19 Mk-85 unit cost increased as the final configuration and production plan are now better defined with completion of Critical Design Review in FY17.

Mk 117 MOD O ROCKET MOTORS: FY18 and FY19 Mk-117 quantity reduced based on sufficient inventory to support BQM-74 operational requirements. Funding realigned to Mk-85 quantities to support operational requirements.
NSWC Indian Head Div Production rates represent combined Mk-85 and Mk-117 rates.

FiscalYear.@footnote: Mk 117 MOD O ROCKET MOTORS: Nominal manufacturing lead-time is 18 months, but prior year production units were delayed due to propellant grain manufacturing issues. Deliveries resumed in FY2016.  FY2014  deliveries will complete in FY2018.
Mk 117 MOD O ROCKET MOTORS: FY2018 Contract award dated changed from December 2017 to January 2018.

Name.@footnote: Production Support RATO: FY18 increases to support initial production start-up costs. FY20 RATO Production Support increases above inflation to satisfy manufacturing infrastructure requirements that have commonality with JATO, as JATO program sundowns.
Production Support JATO: FY18 and FY19 JATO Production Support is required to support OCO production efforts.
